definition: to pull apart/to pry open with the hands
to break off or break open sth with one's hands/(fig.) to break off (a relationship)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
lit. to pull apart and knead to a pulp/fig. to analyze minutely from every angle/to chew sth over

sentences.english: The waiter brought us a dish of orange segments.
sentences.chinese: 服务员给我们端来一盘掰开的橘子瓣。

sentences.english: To get at the truth, let's break downhow you use your body to talk.
sentences.chinese: 为了得到真相，让我们把身体语言掰开揉碎细细说。

sentences.english: Man broke the sun, pulled the wind down.
Internal spaces break apart to reveal stepped terraces and vertical gardens.
sentences.chinese: 内部空间掰开揭示加强梯田和垂直花园。

sentences.english: He split her like a shellfish into two parts.
sentences.chinese: 他像掰开贝壳似的，将她的尸体劈成两半。

sentences.english: She tore the rose apart and scattered the petals over the grave.
sentences.chinese: 她掰开玫瑰花，将花瓣撒在坟墓上。

definition: to pry open or apart/to spread (sth) open with both hands
to break off or break open sth with one's hands/(fig.) to break off (a relationship)
to push aside/to part/to brush away
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
tongue/CL:個|个[ge4]/enemy soldier captured for the purpose of extracting information
